result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas S Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Contact with Cory Schumacher or Alexandra Lloyd only as allowed by the agent. 

Defendant shall have no contact with known drug users or drug dealers.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall submit to random drug screens of his blood, breath, or urine.

Defendant shall notify all health care providers of addiction history.

Defendant shall notify agent within 48 hours of being prescribed medications.

Def appeared in person.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Defendant has contacted Kim & LaVoy and request additional time to come up with retainer.    Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Alyssa Armbrust State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant not SPD eligible.  Defendant will retain counsel if employment maintained.  Defendant missed court as did not receive the summons.  Court finds reasonable excuse for the defendant's failed appearance.  State does not oppose a signature bond.  Court orders $1,000.00 signature bond.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:15 am.
